channel.title: Omfg free vps! im not kidding! (linux only)
channel.description:
http://www.freevps.com/downloads.html
I just downloaded this free vps and it works great! OMFG WHY HAS NOBODY EVER POSTED THIS B4?!!!

item.title: Omfg free vps! im not kidding! (linux only)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Pouch, post:25, topic:340886”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=437280.msg3213500#msg3213500 date=1274491446]

okay so when i dl into linux redhat and install, itll give me a vps, or i turn on a vps put server in and turn off my comp but server will still be on 24/7?

Then how does it work??? I have 3 linux os cds just lying around a windows one…
No…
[/quote][/quote]

Basically it probably strips everything from the OS except what’s needed to run, like a VPS, and may come with apache, some SQL stuff, and Java maybe. That’s it.

item.title: Omfg free vps! im not kidding! (linux only)
item.dc:creator: @HellRain-T HellRain-T
item.description:
@HellRain-T wrote:

There should be no problems with building freevps-tools on RedHat. We develop and test our utilities specifically for building and running them on RedHat 7.3 and RedHat EL.
If your OS is not RedHat, try to create the /usr/include/linux symlink to the $FREEVPS_SRC/include/linux directory, where FREEVPS_SRC is the FreeVPS source files directory.
For example, if your sources are located in /usr/src/linux, the symlink should point to /usr/src/linux/include/linux.

Basically Download RedHat from their site, and if you are having problems use this guide

jmood128:

Do you need linux already to use this?

yes

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @HellRain-T HellRain-T
item.description:
@HellRain-T wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:2, topic:340886”]To host for yourself…?[/quote]No, you have to enter your domain, they host it for you, 5 gb ram, 50 gb hard disk space, 2000 gb traffic/month, 1 ssl certificate, server re-image, data backup, up to 30 domains, Parallels® Virtuozzo Container, Remote desktop connections, DNS managment, 30 subdomains, MSDE 2000, Unlimited MYSQL Database, Site Building tools, and more! its freaking epic!!!

[quote=“jmood128, post:3, topic:340886”]So you install this on your computer and you have your own VPS?[/quote]Read how to set it up, its kind of confusing. Look in the FAQ section

Read full topic
